revised_title: Royal Society's New Home Inauguration at Carlton House Terrace
tldr: The Royal Society inaugurated its new home at 6 Carlton House Terrace on November 21, 1967, with a visit from Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. The event marked the Society's relocation from Burlington House and was attended by many Fellows and distinguished guests. The new premises were praised for their functional suitability and prime location, and the Society expressed gratitude to all those who supported the conversion and renovation of the building.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
